quotes.quote: A gaffe in Washington is when a politician inadvertently reveals the truth, especially about himself.

So I came to Washington, where I knew I would be farther away from America than I could be on some foreign shore; not that I do not respect this as a good part of America but in its general routine the heart of America is felt less here than at any place I have ever been.
People come to Washington believing it is the center of power. I know I did. It was only much later that I learned that Washington is a steering wheel that’s not connected to an engine.

Development does not take place in Washington, DC. Development takes place in the rest of the world.
